page.title: 05RELIGION IN MELBOURNE
page.content: IN THE 19TH CENTURY MELBOURNE WAS DESCRIBED BY ITS THEN VICAR AS "A HOTBED OF DISSENSION".THIS IS EVIDENT FROM THE NUMBER OF NON_CONFORMIST CHAPELS THAT SPRANG UP AT THIS TIME.THE CHURCH OF ENGLAND PARISH CHURCH IS LED BY THE REV.F.ROSS.IT HAS AN AVERAGE OF 180 WORSHIPPERS AND 45 SUNDAY SCHOOL CHILDREN.THE UNITED REFORMED CHURCH HAS 80 WORSHIPPERS AND 90 SUNDAY SCHOOL CHILDREN.THE VICAR IS THE REV.STANICLIFF.THE BAPTIST CHAPEL IS LED BY THE REV.T.M. HARRIS AND HAS AN AVERAGE SUNDAY ATTENDANCE OF 34 WITH 12 SUNDAY SCHOOL CHILDREN.THE METHODIST CHURCH HAS A CONGREGATION OF 30 WITH 20 SUNDAY SCHOOL CHILDREN AND IS LED BY THE REV. A.SPENCER.THE CATHOLIC CHURCH IS LED BY THE REV.PATEMAN AND HAS 100 WORSHIPPERS.THERE ARE ONLY CHRISTIAN CHURCHES IN MELBOURNE.
